item.description: Learn about our journey at PRCCDC 2025, our achievements, and how you can be part of the action.

item.title: About InfoSec Club
item.description:
üëã Welcome to Bellevue College’s InfoSec Club!

We are the Information Security (InfoSec) Club at Bellevue College, dedicated to helping students explore the exciting world of cybersecurity. Our mission is to empower students through hands-on learning, collaboration, and community engagement. Whether you’re new to cybersecurity or already have some experience, our club offers opportunities for everyone to grow, learn, and connect with others who share a passion for security.

item.title: InfoSec Club Resources
item.description:
üê±‚Äçüíª Kali Linux Attackboxes

InfoSec Club is able to provide members with their own VM running Kali Linux. Connect remotely from anywhere using your Bellevue College email and attack over a dozen different vulnerable machines!

item.title: Acceptable Use Policy
item.description:
1. Introduction

This Acceptable Use Policy (“AUP”) is a legal agreement between you (“BC InfoSec Club Member”) and the InfoSec Club at Bellevue College (“BC InfoSec Club”) regarding your use of the PROXMOX virtual machine servers (“Resources”) provided by the BC InfoSec Club. By signing this agreement, you agree to comply with and be bound by the terms and conditions set forth below. If you do not agree to these terms, you are not permitted to use the Resources.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: This Privacy Policy outlines how the InfoSec Club at Bellevue College (“we,” “our,” or “the Club”) collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal information. By joining the Club and using our services, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.
